moves.6. d4: I know I shouldn't really lose one of my central pawns here
moves.6... cxd4 7. Nxd4 Bb7 8. Bd2: Big blunder as now my knight is unprotected
moves.10. Qxe2 Nf6 11. Nd2 d6 12. e5 dxe5: I'm giving a pawn away to expose black's queen.  Hoping to castle queenside and leading to a discovered attack
moves.13. f3: this is to pre-empt the knight coming down the fourth rank
moves.15. O-O-O: my rook is now potentially threatening black queen.
moves.15... Nd5: blocks discovered attack if I move my knight
moves.16. h4: i start the attack on black's king by sending in the infantry
moves.16... Bf6: this i suppose to try to drive my bishop away or possibly exchange to relieve danger to black's g pawn
moves.17... Bg5: pins my knight to king and also stops g6, but means wasted previous move.
moves.18. Kb1: best to move my king out of the line of fire
moves.18... b4: no immediate danger but need to be careful of advance towards my king
moves.19. Ne4: hoping to drive black from existing diagonal and advance pawn later
moves.20. f4: although black's queen is pinned, black could have played 20.... Bxf4, 21. Bxf4 Nxf4 would lead to possible exchanges of Queens and Rooks and white would be at a loss for the rest of the game.  Thanks to Nutcraker for the comment on this.  If 20.....Bxf4, I would probably have played 21. Bxg7 rather than exchange Bishops.
moves.20... Qc8: black moves queen out of danger anyway
moves.22. h6: i can't take black's bishop because black's knight would fork my queen and rook after Nxf4. i decide to press my pawn forward rather than retreating my bishop.
moves.22... Bxe5: Black piles on the material advantage instead of trying to defend.  22...g6 might have stalled my attack.
moves.23. hxg7: punches a hole in the pawn barrier
moves.23... Bxg7 24. Rg3: Black is now in real danger as with his bishop pinned against the king the options for defence are running out.
moves.24... Qd8: The black queen tries in assist in defence.  24......Nf4 and then to g6 might have prevented mate.
moves.25... Nc3+: A last ditch attempt to divert white's forces as 26. Nxc3 would mean black's queen could defend on f6.
moves.26. bxc3:
Black resigns.
Thanks to bottlenose for this game.  I think if anything, this games shows that you can recover from mistakes and focusing on the end result together with some luck can pay dividends.  I was stupidly timed-out on my other Team Game and after my early blunder was determined to put up a good fight.
